Mathematical Models
The equation of a straight line is \(y = mx + b\).


Linear Regression Model
The formula for a simple linear regression is:
\[
y = \beta_0 + \beta_1 x + \epsilon
\]

Where: - \(y\) is the dependent variable. - \(\beta_0\) is the y-intercept. - \(\beta_1\) is the slope of the regression line. - \(x\) is the independent variable. - \(\epsilon\) is the error term.



Data Science Workflow





flowchart LR
    A[Collect Data] --> B[Process Data];
    B --> C[Analyze Data];
    C --> D[Generate Insights];








Contributions to Data Science
The term “Data Science” has evolved over time, with significant contributions made by researchers such as Van Der Aalst, who discusses its applications in Data Science in Action (Van Der Aalst and Aalst 2016). Additionally, Dhar’s article, Data Science and Prediction, outlines how prediction plays a critical role in the field (Dhar 2013).

title: Data Science Presentation
text:
Python Plot Example
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
y = np.sin(x)
plt.plot(x, y)
plt.title('Sine Wave')
plt.xlabel('X Axis')
plt.ylabel('Y Axis')
plt.show()
